IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: FAIRMOUNT HOMES IS A MINISTRY WITH MATURE ADULTS, PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY SERVICES, PROMOTING WHOLENESS AND CREATIVE LIVING CONSISTENT WITH CHRIST-CENTERED MENNONITE VALUES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: FAIRMOUNT HOMES IS A MINISTRY WITH MATURE ADULTS, PROVIDING HIGH QUALITY SERVICES, PROMOTING WHOLENESS AND CREATIVE LIVING CONSISTENT WITH CHRIST-CENTERED MENNONITE VALUES.
IRS990.Desc: PROVIDING HOUSING, HEALTH CARE, AND OTHER RELATED SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY THROUGH THE OPERATION OF A CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY. THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDED 34,492 RESIDENT DAYS FOR SKILLED NURSING CARE, 23,022 RESIDENT DAYS FOR PERSONAL CARE, AND 82,623 RESIDENT DAYS FOR RESIDENTIAL/INDEPENDENT LIVING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE HOME IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT ENTITY DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501 (C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (IRC) AND IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES ON RELATED ACTIVITIES PURSUANT TO 509(A) OF THE IRC. IN ADDITION, THE HOME WAS ORGANIZED UNDER THE PENNSYLVANIA NONPROFIT CORPORATION LAW AND IS EXEMPT FROM STATE INCOME TAXES. THE HOME FOLLOWS THE STANDARDS FOR ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES ACCORDING TO THE PRINCIPLES OF FASB ASC 740, INCOME TAXES, WHICH PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND MEASUREMENT ATTRIBUTE FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. IT REQUIRES MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE HOME, INCLUDING WHETHER THE ENTITY IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT EVALUATED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN AND CONCLUDED THAT THE HOME HAD TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. WITH FEW EXCEPTIONS, THE HOME IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY THE U.S. FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE JUNE 30, 2020.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 113,935. DONATED AUCTION ITEMS -65,260. RENTAL EXPENSES 25,154.
FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 113,935. DONATED AUCTION ITEMS -65,260. RENTAL EXPENSES 25,154.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: WIFE OF BOARD SECRETARY, JAMES WITMER

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AUCTIONS ITEM CONTRIBUTIONS ARE CALCULATED BY THE NUMBER OF EVENTS HELD FOR FUNDRAISING.

KAY DRIVER, VICE PRESIDENT OF FINANCE & CFO WILL BE SIGNING THE RETURN IN REPLACE OF SAMUEL CLEMENT, CFO. KAY DRIVER HAS REPLACED SAMUEL CLEMENT AFTER THE JUNE 30, 2023 DATE AND IS THE CURRENT OFFICER FOR SIGNATURE AUTHORITY.

THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT HAVE ANY INSTANCES WHERE BACKUP WITHHOLDING WAS REQUIRED; HOWEVER, IF THE SITUATION WOULD ARISE, THE ORGANIZATION IS AWARE OF THE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS AND WOULD HANDLE THAT ACCORDINGLY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE OFFICERS FOR ACCURACY AND COMPLETENESS PRIOR TO FILING. A FINAL COPY OF THE 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD FOR THEIR REVIEW AND COMMENT AFTER FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS THROUGH THE CORPORATE COMPLIANCE COMMITTEE, EDUCATION AND DISCUSSION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION PROCESS FOR TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL: COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO IS DETERMINED BY USING THE LEADING AGE PA WAGE SURVEY AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COMPENSATION PROCESS FOR TOP FINANCIAL OFFICIAL: COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS IS DETERMINED BY USING THE LEADING AGE PA WAGE SURVEY AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AND THROUGH THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENT PROCESS.
YES, FAIRMOUNT HOMES HAS A FINANCE COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT, REVIEW, OR COMPILATION OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT.
